title: The Effect of Sample Preparation and Sampling Conditions on Observed Morphology of Lubricating Greases
content: Lubricating greases are used in many diverse applications to reduce friction between moving parts, carrying load, preventing corrosion, and sealing parts from external contaminants [1]. Greases are typically composed of an oil, a thickener, and other performance enhancers. Li-based greases are some of the most widely used, but high demand for lithium for battery applications has increased interest in alternative thickeners. Polyurea-based thickeners are gaining market share due to their high thermal and mechanical stability, especially in electric motor applications.
